title: We played in second - hand gear , there were no anthems ... but we were proud to play for Ireland
body_text:
‘We played in second-hand gear, there were no anthems... but we were proud to play for Ireland’
Trailblazers in women’s football celebrate progress made since first home international in 1973
Ireland’s women’s footballers will make history this afternoon when they line up at the Aviva Stadium for the first time in front of a crowd of more than 37,000 home fans.
It’s a defining moment for women’s football here as the players, fresh from their first World Cup under captain Katie McCabe, kick off their Uefa Nations League campaign against Northern Ireland.
